scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 2 letters sent from Theodore Dreiser to William Waters.

did.unittitle: Letter from Theodore Dreiser to William Waters 22 March 1939

scopecontent.p: Theodore Dreiser, Glendale, California, to William Watters, New York. Includes autograph postscript; explains present situation regarding, My Brother Paul; writes that he is executor of Paul Dresser's estate so book will be handled differently than others; writes that A. Dorian Otvos has exclusives on this idea; asserts that no agent may handle this, unless employed by him.

did.unittitle: Letter from Theodore Dreiser to William Waters 27 March 1939

scopecontent.p: Theodore Dreiser, Glendale, California, to William Watters, New York, wants to follow A. Dorian Otvos' plan; writes that Universal has not contacted him regarding My Brother Paul; asserts that radio possibilities are open; asks for reasonable binder; wishes to do business with him if he figures out something fair to both of them.
